com.github.ilyes4j.gwt.mdl.components

Class CssSwitcher<T extends Enum<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.ilyes4j.gwt.mdl.components.CssSwitcher<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the Enumeration type to manage by the switcher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ButtonColorSwitcher, ButtonTypeSwitcher, FloatSwitcher, InputCheckSwitcher, InputFlipSwitcher, InputRadioSwitcher, LabelCheckSwitcher, LabelFlipSwitcher, LabelRadioSwitcher, MainCheckSwitcher, MainRadioSwitcher, MenuAnchorSwitcher, RippleSwitcher, TooltipPositionSwitcher, TooltipStyleSwitcher

    public abstract class CssSwitcher<T extends Enum<T>>
extends Object
    A switcher have two major purposes :
    1. Remove the boiler plate code from CSS enumerators.

      The switcher defines the CSS class that corresponds to each enumeration constant which avoid polluting the enumeration with the same boilerplate code for storing and accessing the corresponding CSS class.

    2. Manage switching between CSS classes inside components.

      3. Inside the component, the switcher manages the switching between the CSS classes. The switcher is responsible for applying the appropriate CSS class and then removing the previously set CSS class when a new class is applied.

    How to use the switcher

    1. Define a sub-type that appoint the enumeration to be handled
    2. Knowing the enumeration to be managed enables the sub-type to define a static Map member to hold the mapping between the enumeration constants and the CSS class related to the enumerations.
    3. The sub-type defines an implementation of getMappings() that returns the mappings stored in the static member defined earlier. The mappings can be defined in a static block or during the first invocation of the method. But either way, there should always be a single copy of the mappings to optimize memory consumption.
    Author:
    Mohamed Ilyes DIMASSI
